definition: to call to pay one's respect/to call on
to pay respect/worship/visit/salute
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]

sentences.english: Last weekend, we called on our grandparents.
sentences.chinese: 上周末，我们拜望了祖父母。

sentences.english: As it was quite a long period of time, I thought of paying the eminent Professor Ji a visit.
sentences.chinese: 因为住的时间长，就想起去拜望一下季老。

sentences.english: Over time the church festival blended with the Mothering Sunday celebration.
sentences.chinese: 这种教堂里的庆祝活动不断与“拜望双亲日”相混合。

sentences.english: All four bade an affectionate farewell to the Hermit and promised that they would soon visit him again.
sentences.chinese: 四个人马一齐跟隐士依依告别，答应不久再来拜望他。

sentences.english: He is glad that Li Ming went to see him when he was ill.
sentences.chinese: 他很高兴在他生病的时候李明能去拜望他。

sentences.english: During the 1600’s, England celebrated a day called“Mothering Sunday”.
sentences.chinese: 在十七世纪，英国开始庆祝拜望双亲日。

sentences.english: I visit my friend in her house every day.
sentences.chinese: 我每天都在我朋友家里拜望他。

sentences.english: I was visiting a friend who could not find her cordless phone.
sentences.chinese: 我正拜望一位朋友时，她找不到自己无线电话。

definition: pay an official call/call on/visit in an official capacity
to pay a return visit
to pay a formal visit/to call to pay respects/to meet one's senior or superior
to pay a visit/to call on
to pay a formal visit/to call to pay respects/to pay homage (at a monument, mausoleum etc)
to say goodbye/leave-taking/farewells
congratulate an elderly person on his birthday/offer birthday felicitations
to visit/to call on sb/to look around
to visit/to pay a call to
to attend a banquet
to visit sb at home
former acquaintance/old friend
I beg to disturb you/I trespass on your hospitality/Thank you for your hospitality!
to pay one's respects/to give regards to
to chat
(polite) your home/residence
